channel.title: Need Help [1 line of PHP/MySQL code..]
channel.description:
I've seriously been on this for over 4 hours trying to get this to work. I know there's a simple fucking way, I just don't know much about PHP and I'd appreciate if someone can help me correct this.
mysql_query("UPDATE Votes2 SET amount='amount + 1' WHERE ip='$ip'", $link);
So about this.. If I replace amount + 1 with 1, it changes it in the table to 1. If I replace it to 0, it changes to 0. That removes the question if "Is it even running that?" because yes, it is working properly.
But, when it's amount + 1, what I want it to do is, grab the "amount" variable, and add 1 to it. So, if the amount is 1, it changes to 2.
I've also tried changing it to $amount + 1, and of course $amount+1 or amount+1 doesn't change anything, so please don't suggest that.
I'd appreciate a response with an answer, if you could, not something to waste my time.
tl;dr, how can I grab the "amount" variable and add 1 to it, then re write it to the SQL table

Your problem is the single quotes around ‘amount + 1’, remove those.[/quote]
I appreciate your help, Mopar.

I spent 4 hours trying to figure out what I was doing wrong (Not even exaggerating), but right after I posted this, I removed those and it worked fine. Should have edited.

If you happen to read this again, what’s the exact day you’ll be opening sponsored servers again? I don’t remember what the last one was, seems like it was the 10th-15th.
